New Records: Pete Alonso launched his second home run off Aaron Nola in the series and third in New York's past four playoff games.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso sent Nola's first pitch of the second deep to right field.
Manaea was lifted after allowing an infield single to start the eighth.
Jesse Winker also went deep and Starling Marte had a pivotal two-run single to help the wild-card Mets.
Lindor, playing his first home game since Sept. 8 because of a back injury, delivered a run-scoring double in the bottom half to make it 7-2.
Pre-Game Insights: Suárez, who went 2-0 with a 2.30 ERA in three outings against the Mets this season, had a 6.04 ERA in five September starts totaling only 22 1/3 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: “It would be fantastic to get it done, but we’ve got to stay within ourselves,” Alonso said.
“Felt like he wanted this moment,” teammate Francisco Lindor said. “He gave everything he had.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game 4 is Wednesday, with All-Star Ranger Suárez scheduled to start for Philadelphia against fellow lefty José Quintana.
A win advances New York to the National League Championship Series to face the Los Angeles Dodgers or San Diego Padres.
